adjective.description: Coming after all others in time or order; final.
synonyms: at the back of the queue

adverb.description: On the last occasion before the present; previously.
examples: he looked much older than when I'd last seen him

adverb.description: After all others in order or sequence.
(especially in enumerating points) finally; in conclusion.
examples: and last, I'd like to thank you all for coming

noun.description: The last person or thing; the one occurring, mentioned, or acting after all others.
examples: the last of their guests had gone
eating as if every mouthful were his last

verb.description: (of a process, activity, or state of things) continue for a specified period of time.
examples: the guitar solo lasted for twenty minutes

verb.description: Continue to function well or to be in good condition for a considerable or specified length of time.
examples: the car is built to last
a lip pencil lasts longer than lipstick

phrases: you've come back to me at last!
Coupled with the power in your house of partners, it's clear you are at last ready to settle down.
The second reason why I have confidence about the future is that, at long last, sponsors are taking a stand.
John sent back some of his first earnings from Germany to Mimi, proud that he could help her at last.
Tired but home at last, the kid jumps out of the car and gently rubs his face.
origin: Old English lǣste, of Germanic origin, from a base meaning follow; related to Dutch leest and German Leisten.
